name: heretically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is opposite to or that goes against the official or popular opinion, or that shows no respect for the official opinion: My friends looked at me with astonishment because I heretically questioned whether their favourite video game was really any good. Heretically, she dared to suggest that we try a different restaurant to our usual one.
in a way that goes against the principles of a particular religion: He was admonished by the church for publishing his scientific findings, which heretically contradicted the teachings of the Bible. The pastor was defrocked by church leaders for giving sermons that departed heretically from Christian orthodoxy. Related words
heretic
heresy
